ErrorIndex.title: Wrapper for index information inside an error.

ErrorResponse.description: Generic error response for REST APIs

code.description: the numeric HTTP error code for the response.

details.description: The optional details of the error response.

dictionary.description:
Dictionary/map of associated data/information relevant to the error.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted
with information from this dictionary.

errors.description:
Collection of errors in cases where more than one exists. This needs to be
flexible so we can support multiple formats

internal.description: Internal error code in cases where we don't have an array of errors

message.description: The basic text error message for the error response.

ref.description: Reference to the error source. Should typically be the URI of the request

type.description:
URI pointing at a document that describes the error and mitigation steps
If there is no document, point to the RFC for the HTTP error code

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: A valid name is made up of one or more components where each component is separated by period characters.  Each component must start and end with a lower case alphanumeric character and the body of the component is made up of zero or more lower case alphanumeric and hyphen characters.

Status.title: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

com.nokia.eda.protocols.v1alpha1.Aggrega.description: AggregateRoute is the Schema for the aggregateroutes API

spec.description: The AggregateRoute enables the configuration of aggregated routes on a specified Router. This resource allows for the definition of destination prefixes, the selection of a router, and optionally, specific nodes where the aggregate routes should be configured. Advanced options include the ability to generate ICMP unreachable messages for packets matching the aggregate route, and the ability to block the advertisement of all contributing routes in dynamic protocols like BGP.

generateICMP.description: When set to true the router generares ICMP unreachable messages for packets matching the aggregate route (and not a more specific route).
generateICMP.title: Generate ICMP

nodes.description: List of nodes on which to configure the aggregate routes. An AND operation is executed against the nodes in this list and the nodes on which the Router is configured to determine the Nodes on which to configure the aggregate routes.
nodes.title: Nodes

prefixes.description: List of destination prefixes for the aggregate routes.
prefixes.title: Prefixes

router.description: Reference to a Router on which to configure the aggregate routes.  If no Nodes are provided then the aggregate routes will be provisioned on all Nodes on which the Router is provisioned.
router.title: Router

summaryOnly.description: When set to true the router blocks the advertisement of all contributing routes of this aggregate route in dynamic protocols such as BGP.
summaryOnly.title: Summary Only

spec.title: Specification

status.description: AggregateRouteStatus defines the observed state of AggregateRoute
status.title: Status

com.nokia.eda.protocols.v1alpha1.Aggrega.description: AggregateRouteList is a list of aggregateroutes

com.nokia.eda.protocols.v1alpha1.BGPGrou.description: BGPGroup is the Schema for the bgpgroups API

spec.description: The BGPGroup enables centralized management of BGP peer configurations. This resource allows setting a description, common BGP settings, and peer-specific configurations, simplifying the consistent application of policies across multiple peers. It also includes transport settings, such as local TCP address configuration, passive mode, and TCP MSS.

allowOwnAS.description: The maximum number of times the global AS number or a local AS number of the BGP instance can appear in any received AS_PATH before it is considered a loop and considered invalid.
allowOwnAS.title: Allow Own AS

removePrivateAS.description: Options for removing private AS numbers (2-byte and 4-byte) from the advertised AS path towards all peers.

ignorePeerAS.description: If set to true then do not delete or replace a private AS number that is the same as the peer AS number.
ignorePeerAS.title: Ignore Peer AS

leadingOnly.description: If set to true then only delete or replace private AS numbers that appear before the first occurrence of a non-private ASN in the sequence of most recent ASNs in the AS path.
leadingOnly.title: Leading Only

removePrivateASMode.description: The method by which private AS numbers are removed from the advertised AS_PATH attribute.
removePrivateASMode.title: Remove Private AS Mode

removePrivateAS.title: Remove Private AS

bfd.description: Enable or disable Bi-forward Forwarding Detection (BFD) with fast failover.
bfd.title: BFD

client.description: When set to true, all configured and dynamic BGP peers are considered RR clients.
client.title: Route Reflector Client

clusterID.description: Enables route reflect client and sets the cluster ID.
clusterID.title: Cluster ID

description.description: Sets the description on the BGP group.
description.title: Description

exportPolicy.description: Reference to a Policy CR that will be used to filter routes advertised to peers.
exportPolicy.title: Export Policy

grStaleRouteTime.description: Enables Graceful Restart on the peer and sets the stale route time.
grStaleRouteTime.title: GR Stale Route Time

importPolicy.description: Reference to a Policy CR that will be used to filter routes received from peers.
importPolicy.title: Import Policy

advertiseIPV6NextHops.description: Enables advertisement of IPv4 Unicast routes with IPv6 next-hops to peers.
advertiseIPV6NextHops.title: Advertise IPv6 Next Hops

maxReceivedRoutes.description: Maximum number of IPv4 Unicast routes that will be accepted from the neighbor, counting routes accepted and rejected by import policies.
maxReceivedRoutes.title: Max Received Routes

receiveIPV6NextHops.description: Enables the advertisement of the RFC 5549 capability to receive IPv4 routes with IPv6 next-hops.
receiveIPV6NextHops.title: Receive IPv6 Next Hops

maxReceivedRoutes.title: Max Received Routes

keychain.description: Reference to a Keychain resource that will be used for authentication with the BGP peer.
keychain.title: Keychain

localAS.description: The local autonomous system number advertised to peers.

prependGlobalAS.description: When set to true, the global ASN value is prepended to the AS path in outbound routes towards each BGP peer.
prependGlobalAS.title: Prepend Global Autonomous System

prependLocalAS.description: When set to true, the local AS value is prepended to the AS path of inbound routes from each EBGP peer.
prependLocalAS.title: Prepend Local Autonomous System

localAS.title: Local AS

localPreference.description: Local Preference attribute added to received routes from the BGP peers, also sets local preference for generated routes.
localPreference.title: Local Preference

multiHopMaxHop.description: Enable multihop for eBGP peers and sets the maximum number of hops allowed.
multiHopMaxHop.title: Multihop Max Hop Count

nextHopSelf.description: When set to true, the next-hop in all IPv4-unicast, IPv6-unicast and EVPN BGP routes advertised to the peer is set to the local-address.
nextHopSelf.title: Next Hop Self

peerAS.description: The autonomous system number expected from peers.
peerAS.title: Peer AS

sendCommunityLarge.description: When false, all large (12 byte) BGP communities from all outbound routes advertised to the peer are stripped.
sendCommunityLarge.title: Send Community Large

sendCommunityStandard.description: When false, all standard (4 byte) communities from all outbound routes advertised to the peer are stripped.
sendCommunityStandard.title: Send Community Standard

sendDefaultRoute.description: Options for controlling the generation of default routes towards BGP peers.

exportPolicy.description: Reference to a Policy that should be applied to the advertised default routes, in order to set their attributes to non-default values.
exportPolicy.title: Export Policy

sendDefaultRoute.title: Send Default Route

connectRetry.description: The time interval in seconds between successive attempts to establish a session with a peer.
connectRetry.title: Connect Retry

holdTime.description: The hold-time interval in seconds that the router proposes to the peer in its OPEN message.
holdTime.title: Hold Time

keepAlive.description: The interval in seconds between successive keepalive messages sent to the peer.
keepAlive.title: Keep Alive

minimumAdvertisementInterval.description: The value assigned to the MinRouteAdvertisementIntervalTimer of RFC 4271, for both EBGP and IBGP sessions.
minimumAdvertisementInterval.title: Minimum Advertisement Interval

spec.description: DefaultAggregateRoute allows the configuration of aggregate routes on a DefaultRouter. It includes specifying destination prefixes, the DefaultRouter, and settings for generating ICMP unreachable messages or blocking route advertisement. Additionally, it configures the aggregator’s IP address and ASN for efficient route management.

prefixes.title: Prefixes

summaryOnly.title: Summary Only

spec.description: RouteReflectorClient manages the configuration of iBGP sessions between a client and RouteReflectors. This resource allows you to specify the Interface for BGP sessions, set selectors for RouteReflectors, and configure common BGP settings.

allowOwnAS.description: The maximum number of times the global AS number or a local AS number of the BGP instance can appear in any received AS_PATH before it is considered a loop and considered invalid.
allowOwnAS.title: Allow Own AS

removePrivateAS.description: Options for removing private AS numbers (2-byte and 4-byte) from the advertised AS path towards all peers.

ignorePeerAS.description: If set to true then do not delete or replace a private AS number that is the same as the peer AS number.
ignorePeerAS.title: Ignore Peer AS

leadingOnly.description: If set to true then only delete or replace private AS numbers that appear before the first occurrence of a non-private ASN in the sequence of most recent ASNs in the AS path.
leadingOnly.title: Leading Only

removePrivateASMode.description: The method by which private AS numbers are removed from the advertised AS_PATH attribute.
removePrivateASMode.title: Remove Private AS Mode

removePrivateAS.title: Remove Private AS

bfd.description: Enable or disable Bi-forward Forwarding Detection (BFD) with fast failover.
bfd.title: BFD

exportPolicy.description: Reference to a Policy CR that will be used to filter routes advertised to peers.
exportPolicy.title: Export Policy

grStaleRouteTime.description: Enables Graceful Restart on the peer and sets the stale route time.
grStaleRouteTime.title: GR Stale Route Time

importPolicy.description: Reference to a Policy CR that will be used to filter routes received from peers.
importPolicy.title: Import Policy

interface.description: Reference to a RoutedInterface or IrbInterface resource whose IP will be used as a source IP for the BGP session.
interface.title: Interface Reference

interfaceKind.description: InterfaceReference type defines whether the provided Reference is a RoutedInterface or IrbInterface.
interfaceKind.title: Interface Reference Type

ipv4RouteReflectorSelector.description: Label selector used to select the RouteReflectors to which the iBGP sessions are established for IPv4.
ipv4RouteReflectorSelector.title: IPv4 Route Reflector Selector

ipv4Unicast.description: Parameters relating to the IPv4 unicast AFI/SAFI.

advertiseIPV6NextHops.description: Enables advertisement of IPv4 Unicast routes with IPv6 next-hops to peers.
advertiseIPV6NextHops.title: Advertise IPv6 Next Hops

maxReceivedRoutes.description: Maximum number of IPv4 Unicast routes that will be accepted from the neighbor, counting routes accepted and rejected by import policies.
maxReceivedRoutes.title: Max Received Routes

receiveIPV6NextHops.description: Enables the advertisement of the RFC 5549 capability to receive IPv4 routes with IPv6 next-hops.
receiveIPV6NextHops.title: Receive IPv6 Next Hops

ipv4Unicast.title: IPv4 Unicast

ipv6RouteReflectorSelector.description: Label selector used to select the RouteReflectors to which the iBGP sessions are established for IPv6.
ipv6RouteReflectorSelector.title: IPv6 Route Reflector Selector

ipv6Unicast.description: Parameters relating to the IPv6 unicast AFI/SAFI.

maxReceivedRoutes.description: Maximum number of IPv6 Unicast routes that will be accepted from the neighbor, counting routes accepted and rejected by import policies.
maxReceivedRoutes.title: Max Received Routes

ipv6Unicast.title: IPv6 Unicast

keychain.description: Reference to a Keychain resource that will be used for authentication with the BGP peer.
keychain.title: Keychain

localAS.description: The local autonomous system number advertised to peers.

prependGlobalAS.description: When set to true, the global ASN value is prepended to the AS path in outbound routes towards each BGP peer.
prependGlobalAS.title: Prepend Global Autonomous System

prependLocalAS.description: When set to true, the local AS value is prepended to the AS path of inbound routes from each EBGP peer.
prependLocalAS.title: Prepend Local Autonomous System

localAS.title: Local AS

peerAS.description: The autonomous system number expected from peers.
peerAS.title: Peer AS

routeReflectorIPs.description: List of the peering IPs on the RRs to which peering session is established.
routeReflectorIPs.title: Route Reflector IPs

sendCommunityLarge.description: When false, all large (12 byte) BGP communities from all outbound routes advertised to the peer are stripped.
sendCommunityLarge.title: Send Community Large

sendCommunityStandard.description: When false, all standard (4 byte) communities from all outbound routes advertised to the peer are stripped.
sendCommunityStandard.title: Send Community Standard

sendDefaultRoute.description: Options for controlling the generation of default routes towards BGP peers.

addressFamily.description: Enables the sending of a synthetically generated default IPv4 or IPV6 route to each peer.
addressFamily.title: Address Families

exportPolicy.description: Reference to a Policy that should be applied to the advertised default routes, in order to set their attributes to non-default values.
exportPolicy.title: Export Policy

sendDefaultRoute.title: Send Default Route

connectRetry.description: The time interval in seconds between successive attempts to establish a session with a peer.
connectRetry.title: Connect Retry

holdTime.description: The hold-time interval in seconds that the router proposes to the peer in its OPEN message.
holdTime.title: Hold Time

keepAlive.description: The interval in seconds between successive keepalive messages sent to the peer.
keepAlive.title: Keep Alive

minimumAdvertisementInterval.description: The value assigned to the MinRouteAdvertisementIntervalTimer of RFC 4271, for both EBGP and IBGP sessions.
minimumAdvertisementInterval.title: Minimum Advertisement Interval

spec.title: Specification

ui-conditions.errorMsg: At least one of ipv4Unicast, ipv6Unicast, or l2VPNEVPN must be enabled

status.description: RouteReflectorClientStatus defines the observed state of RouteReflectorClient

health.description: Indicates the health score of the RouteReflectorClient.
health.title: Health

healthScoreReason.description: Indicates the reason for the health score.
healthScoreReason.title: Health Score Reason

lastChange.description: The time when the state of the resource last changed.
lastChange.title: Last Change

numRouteReflectorClientBGPPeers.description: Total number of configured route reflector peers on the route reflector client.
numRouteReflectorClientBGPPeers.title: Number of Route Reflector Client BGP Peers

numRouteReflectorClientBGPPeersOperDown.description: Total number of configured route reflector peers on the route reflector client that are operationally down.
numRouteReflectorClientBGPPeersOperDown.title: Number of Oper Down Route Reflector Client BGP Peers

operDownRouteReflectorClientPeers.description: List of route reflector BGPPeers which are operationally down.
operDownRouteReflectorClientPeers.title: Oper Down Route Reflector Client Peers

status.title: Status

com.nokia.eda.protocols.v1alpha1.StaticR.description: StaticRoute is the Schema for the staticroutes API

spec.description: StaticRoute allows for the specification of destination prefixes, route preferences, and the associated Router. It also supports configuring nexthop groups and specifying the nodes where the static routes should be provisioned.

nexthopGroup.description: Group of nexthops for the list of prefixes.

bfd.description: Enables BFD to the next-hops in the group.

enabled.description: Defines whether BFD should be enabled towards the nexthops.
enabled.title: Enabled

localAddress.description: Defines the local address to use when establishing the BFD session with the nexthop.
localAddress.title: Local Address

bfd.title: BFD

blackhole.description: If set to true all traffic destined to the prefixes will be blackholed.  If enabled, next-hops are ignored and this takes precedence.
blackhole.title: Blackhole

bfd.description: Enables BFD to the next-hops in the group. This overrides the configuration at the group.

enabled.description: Defines whether BFD should be enabled towards the nexthops.
enabled.title: Enabled

localAddress.description: Defines the local address to use when establishing the BFD session with the nexthop.
localAddress.title: Local Address

bfd.title: BFD

resolve.description: If set to true the next-hops can be destinations which are resolved in the route table. This overrides the configuration at the group.
resolve.title: Resolve

resolve.description: If set to true the next-hops can be destinations which are resolved in the route table.
resolve.title: Resolve

nexthopGroup.title: Nexthop Group

nodes.description: List of nodes on which to configure the static routes. An AND operation is executed against the nodes in this list and the nodes on which the Router is configured to determine the Nodes on which to configure the static routes.
nodes.title: Nodes

prefixes.description: List of destination prefixes and mask to use for the static routes.
prefixes.title: Prefixes

router.description: Reference to a Router on which to configure the static routes.  If no Nodes are provided then the static routes will be provisioned on all Nodes on which the Router is provisioned.
router.title: Router

spec.title: Specification

status.description: StaticRouteStatus defines the observed state of Static Route

health.description: Indicates the health score of the static routes.
health.title: Health

healthScoreReason.description: Indicates the reason for the health score.
healthScoreReason.title: Health Score Reason

lastChange.description: The time when the state of the resource last changed.
lastChange.title: Last Change

nodes.description: List of Nodes on which the static routes are configured.
nodes.title: Nodes

operationalState.description: Operational state of the static routes.
operationalState.title: Operational State

status.title: Status
